alert.note: Alert for Orange County Coastal (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 04 at 2:20AM PST until January 06 at 6:00PM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON THURSDAY TO 6 PM PST FRIDAY... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON THURSDAY TO 6 PM PST FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, minor coastal flooding expected. For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 8 to 13 feet. * WHERE...Orange County Coastal Areas. * WHEN...From noon Thursday to 6 PM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of lots, parks, and roads with only isolated road closures expected. Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A westerly swell of 10 to 13 feet and a period of 16 to 18 seconds from 270 degrees will produce very high surf. The surf will steadily increase late Thursday to around 8 feet, then increase to as high as 13 feet early Friday morning. The limiting factor will be the southwest versus west orientation of the coastline. This should be a short-lived event as the swell will subside rapidly late Friday and Friday night.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions.
